channel.title: Alternative way to perform Windows Update (Through Firefox or Opera!)
channel.description:
Really, the only reason I open up IE is to perform Windows Update. Well now its not even good for that. :D Note* [s]This will [i]only[/i] work for Firefox users.[/s] Firefox and Opera. If your viewing this page in IE leave. Download & install Firefox or Opera, then comeback and read the rest. :) Alright first off go to: [url=http://windowsupdate.62nds.com/]http://windowsupdate.62nds.com/[/url] Click the "download and install" button Now up at the top of your browser a message like this will come down. [IMG]http://i116.photobucket.com/albums/o26/photos_r_me/windiz2.jpg[/img] Click on edit options, and then allow, then close it. Click the download and install button again and install the plugin. After the plugin installs (no need to restart Firefox) you will be taken back to the site. Now you see an option "Scan for Updates" after clicking this you'll receive a warning from Firefox about a site trying to access your computer. Click "Allow Site" and the search will continue. *Those of you that are worrying about the site searching your computer, don't. Incase you didn't know, the original update does the same thing. If that doesn't convince you, look at it this way: Would you rather have Firefox search your computer... or IE. My point exactly. ;) After the scan is complete the rest of the layout is pretty much the same as the Microsoft site. After you have selected your updates proceed to "Install Updates" and they'll begin being downloaded. [b]NOTE[/b] *You can't use Firefox at this time! Although most of you have highspeed connections anyway so I don't think it matters much. If you want to cancel just click "Cancel" and next time you go to the site and update, it will start where you left off. [IMG]http://i116.photobucket.com/albums/o26/photos_r_me/windiz.jpg[/img] After its done downloading the updates, it will automatically install them. Again you [b]can't[/b] close the Firefox browser if you want them to be installed. [IMG]http://i116.photobucket.com/albums/o26/photos_r_me/installing.jpg[/img] After its done installing a done message will appear along with the usual reminder that the updates won't take place until you restart your computer. [IMG]http://i116.photobucket.com/albums/o26/photos_r_me/done.jpg[/img] You can now close the page. Your done. Your computer is updated. :D [size=12pt][b]But why doesn't WindizUpdate show all the updates the Microsoft site will? [/b][/size]
"I've read around it seems to be even smarter than Windows Update as it identifies what Windows components you have installed and only offers relevant patches."
No sense in downloading patches that you don't need eh? ;) Now you can take that one advantage IE had over Firefox/Opera and cross it off. So now that leaves IE with...?
